plants.name: Rosa chinensis
plants.description: A species of rose native to Southwest China, known for its repeat flowering habit and rich fragrance. It has contributed significantly to the breeding of modern garden roses.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring to Fall (mostly May to October)
plants.funFact: Many modern rose varieties originate from this species, notable for blooming repeatedly throughout the growing season.

plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: A tall, graceful lily with large, trumpet-shaped white flowers. It is prized both as an ornamental plant and for its fragrant flowers.
plants.location: Native to the Balkans and the eastern Mediterranean, widely cultivated in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Historically associated with purity and the Virgin Mary, hence the name "Madonna Lily."

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: An evergreen shrub that produces clusters of showy, fragrant flowers. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in warm climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring to Autumn (starting April or May)
plants.location: Mediterranean region, cultivated in warm climates worldwide
plants.funFact: All parts of oleander are highly toxic, yet it remains popular for ornamental use in hot, dry areas.

plants.name: Ipomoea tricolor
plants.description: A fast-growing annual vine that produces large, vivid trumpet-shaped flowers opening early in the day.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late Spring to Autumn (May to October)
plants.location: Native to Central America, widely cultivated as an ornamental worldwide
plants.funFact: The blue dye extracted from some species of morning glory was used in traditional rituals by indigenous peoples.
